alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis; North St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 8:59AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern St. Louis County through 930 AM CDT... At 857 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Nett Lake, to near Meadow Brook, to 9 miles southeast of Togo, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported dime sized hail 6 miles west of Greaney at 854 AM. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Nett Lake around 905 AM CDT. Orr, Ash Lake and Pelican Lake around 910 AM CDT. Cook, Gheen and Cusson around 915 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Lake Vermilion, Crane Lake, Buyck and Kettle Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters.

area.areaDesc: Central St. Louis; North St. Louis
